caption.p: Role of global-scale versus regional-scale mitigation. Schematics based on the ESR-CMIP5 relationship of TXx versus change in global mean temperature in the Mediterranean region (from [ 5], see also figure 1), with zoom on changes up to 2°C of global warming. Reduced regional impacts can be achieved both through a decrease in the global mean temperature (light blue arrow, ‘global-scale mitigation’), as well as through a reduction in the regional sensitivity of temperature extremes to global temperature changes (violet arrow, ‘regional-scale mitigation’).
